name: Palestine
currentCrisisSummary:
Occupied Palestine, especially Gaza, endures an intensifying catastrophe inflicted by **Israeli settler colonialism** and **occupation**. This includes mass displacement, widespread civilian death, systematic destruction of public services, and crisis levels of **starvation and disease deliberately induced** through siege and bombardment.

The **ICJ** found claims of **genocide in Gaza plausible**; **accountability** efforts continue at the **ICC**. This extreme violence is enabled by unwavering **Western support** (especially US) and compounded by **internal Palestinian political fragmentation** and the **strategic abandonment** by key **Arab states** pursuing normalisation.

imperialRoot.legacy:
The crisis is rooted in policies enacted under the **British Mandate**. The 1917 **Balfour Declaration** endorsed a 'national home for the Jewish people' while promising to protect non-Jewish communities â€” a contradiction Britain didn't resolve.

Mandate policies facilitated **Zionist settlement** and undermined indigenous Arab rights. Britain's suppression of Palestinian movements and its 1948 withdrawal preceded the war and the ***Nakba***, during which 700k-750k Palestinians became refugees.

The refugee crisis, **dispossession**, and **Mandate precedents** inform today's structures of **occupation** and exclusion.

historicalContext.title: Geopolitical Involvement
historicalContext.description:
**Western states** â€” especially the **United States** â€” provide sustained **military aid**, **arms transfers**, and **diplomatic protection**, allowing Israeli **occupation** and **expansionist policies** to continue with impunity. This **strategic alignment** reinforces the power imbalance.

**Defence industries** benefit, and states gain a regional ally.

historicalContext.title: Settler Colonialism and Apartheid
historicalContext.description:
The conflict is fundamentally **settler colonialism**: policies of **land expropriation**, **settlement expansion**, **movement restrictions**, and **disenfranchisement** producing permanent **colonial structures**. Human rights organisations find Israeli measures meet the threshold of **apartheid**.

This system is also economic/spatial: **land seizures**, **settler infrastructure**, **discriminatory resource allocation** create **structural dependency**.

historicalContext.title: The Settlement Project and Two-Tier Legal System
historicalContext.description: Since 1967, Israel has constructed over 280 **illegal settlements** and outposts in the occupied West Bank and East Jerusalem, violating the **Fourth Geneva Convention**. This project is the primary engine of **land theft**, **resource expropriation**, and **territorial fragmentation**. It is enforced by a **two-tier legal system** amounting to **apartheid**: Israeli settlers live under Israeli civil law, while Palestinians live under military rule. This system is designed to service and protect settlers, enabling **state-sanctioned settler violence** and the systematic displacement of Palestinian communities.

historicalContext.title: Internal Fragmentation: Fatah-Hamas Split
historicalContext.description: Palestinian political life is deeply fractured, primarily by the **split between Fatah** (dominant in the PA/West Bank) **and Hamas** (governing Gaza since 2007). This division, often exploited by Israel, prevents a unified strategy, weakens Palestinian agency, and has resulted in two separate, competing political authorities. The **Palestinian Authority (PA)** itself faces criticism for **authoritarianism, corruption,** and its **security coordination** with the Israeli occupation under the Oslo framework.

historicalContext.title: Role of Arab States: Blockade & Normalisation
historicalContext.description: Key **Arab states** play a complex, often **complicit role**. **Egypt** has enforced the **Gaza blockade** alongside Israel since 2007, controlling the Rafah crossing. More broadly, the trend of **normalisation agreements (Abraham Accords)** between Israel and states like the **UAE, Bahrain, Morocco, and Sudan** represents a **strategic abandonment** of the Palestinian cause, prioritising economic and security ties with Israel/US over Palestinian rights.

historicalContext.title: The Oslo Accords and Neoliberal Subjugation
historicalContext.description: The 1993 **Oslo Accords**, rather than leading to sovereignty, created a framework for **economic and political subjugation** under a **neoliberal guise**. The 1994 **Paris Protocol** locked the Palestinian economy into **dependency** on Israel. This '**economic peace**' created the **Palestinian Authority (PA)**, reliant on foreign aid, whose security forces often coordinate with the **occupation**, while **settlement expansion** accelerated.

historicalContext.title: International Law and Accountability
historicalContext.description: Post-Oct 2023, legal processes were activated following overwhelming evidence of violations of the **Genocide Convention**. The **ICJ** found **plausible genocide** allegations and ordered **provisional measures**. The **ICC** investigates **war crimes**, though its jurisdiction faces political challenges. Despite these mechanisms, **enforcement** remains limited due to **US/Israeli** **veto power** at the **UN Security Council**. The **International Court of Justice** ruling represents a critical legal precedent but lacks enforcement mechanisms. **Universal jurisdiction** cases in various countries offer potential alternatives. Western **arms suppliers** continue to provide materials used in violations with **impunity**, highlighting the **selective application** of international law by powerful states. **Accountability** is further hindered by the **asymmetry** in international legal processes that allow Israeli officials to travel freely while Palestinian rights remain unenforced.

humanitarianImpact.title: Casualties
humanitarianImpact.description: Estimated 67,000+ killed in Gaza since Oct 2023 by **Israeli military assaults**, part of a **plausible genocide**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Gaza's entire population (2.3M) faces **catastrophe deliberately inflicted through bombardment and siege.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: Entire Gaza population suffers crisis-level hunger (over 1M catastrophic), **engineered through Israel's blockade and destruction of food systems.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 1.9M internally displaced in Gaza (nearly 90%) by **Israeli military operations constituting ethnic cleansing.** In parallel, in the West Bank, thousands of Palestinians face **ongoing forced displacement** through **settler pogroms**, **mass demolitions**, and the creation of 'firing zones', particularly in areas like **Masafer Yatta** and the Jordan Valley, to enable **settlement expansion**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugees
humanitarianImpact.description: 5.9M registered Palestinian refugees denied **right of return**, reliant on UNRWA - direct legacy of **1948** *Nakba* (ethnic cleansing).

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Gaza's healthcare system **systematically dismantled by Israeli attacks.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Lack of Water Access
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 95% of Gaza's water unfit due to **Israeli infrastructural destruction and restrictions.** In the West Bank, Israel maintains control of over 85% of Palestinian water resources, **systematically diverting** the Mountain Aquifer to **illegal settlements**â€”which receive unrestricted supplyâ€”while imposing **engineered scarcity** and **infrastructural decay** on Palestinian towns and agriculture.

humanitarianImpact.title: Education Denied
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 625,000 children in Gaza denied education by **Israeli bombardment destroying schools.**

timeline.event: **First Zionist Congress**: Held in Basel, Switzerland, the congress formally establishes the political Zionist movement. Its goal is to create a Jewish state in Palestine, a project which involved the displacement of the indigenous Palestinian population.
**Balfour Declaration**: Britain issues the Balfour Declaration, promising support for a 'national home for the Jewish people' in Palestine, disregarding the indigenous Arab population.
**The Nakba ('Catastrophe')**: Over 750,000 Palestinians were expelled or fled from their homes and land during the 1948 war, as Zionist militias established the state of Israel.
**The Naksa ('Setback')**: Israel occupies the West Bank, Gaza Strip, and East Jerusalem in the Six-Day War, imposing a military rule that continues to this day.

**Illegal Settlement Enterprise**: Immediately following the 1967 occupation, Israel begins building settlements in the West Bank, Gaza, and East Jerusalem in violation of international law. This state-led project of **land expropriation** and **population transfer** becomes the central mechanism of **dispossession** and **apartheid**.

**Oslo Accords**: A US-led 'peace process' creates the Palestinian Authority (PA). Its economic protocols lock Palestinians into dependency on Israel, providing cover for accelerated settlement expansion under the guise of negotiations.

**Fatah-Hamas Split & Gaza Blockade**: Following Hamas's victory in the 2006 elections, internal conflict leads to Hamas taking control of Gaza. Israel and Egypt impose a land, air, and sea blockade, which the UN describes as illegal 'collective punishment'.
**Great March of Return**: Mass civilian protests in Gaza demanding the right of return are met with lethal force by Israeli forces, killing hundreds and wounding tens of thousands.

**Abraham Accords**: The US brokers normalisation agreements between Israel and the UAE and Bahrain (later joined by Sudan and Morocco), signalling a shift in Arab state policy away from the Palestinian cause.

**Escalation of Settler Violence**: Amidst the plausible genocide in Gaza, state-backed **settler pogroms** intensify in the West Bank, operating with impunity to terrorise and forcibly displace entire Palestinian communities.

**October 7th**: After 16 years of an Israeli and Egyptian blockade, Hamas leads an attack on Israel; Israel launches a massive assault on Gaza in response. The ICJ has since ruled that claims of genocide in Gaza are plausible.
**ICJ Plausible Genocide Ruling**: The ICJ rules that claims of genocide in Gaza are plausible, ordering provisional measures against Israel.

**Fragile Ceasefire**: A ceasefire is declared on October 10. The agreement is immediately tenuous, with human rights monitors reporting over 80 Israeli violations and at least 97 Palestinian deaths in Gaza within the first 10 days.

advocacy.title: Support BDS (Boycott, Divestment, Sanctions)
advocacy.description: Support the **Palestinian-led, non-violent BDS movement**. Modelled on the South African anti-apartheid movement, it pressures Israel to comply with international law by ending the occupation, granting full equality to Palestinian citizens, and honouring the right of return for refugees.

advocacy.title: End Military Aid and Arms Sales
advocacy.description: Advocate for an end to all **military aid and arms sales** to Israel that are used in violation of international law, particularly from Western enablers like the US and Germany.

advocacy.title: Demand Targeted Sanctions
advocacy.description: Demand **targeted sanctions** on Israeli officials, **militant settler organisations** (e.g., Hilltop Youth), and **international entities** (e.g., JNF) responsible for war crimes, **apartheid**, and the financing and construction of **illegal settlements**.

advocacy.title: Support Legal Accountability
advocacy.description: Support the **genocide case against Israel at the ICJ** and **war crimes investigations at the ICC** to challenge state impunity.

advocacy.title: Call for Palestinian Unity
advocacy.description: Support Palestinian efforts towards internal reconciliation and political unity to strengthen their struggle for self-determination.
